eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RepeatEveryXSeconds
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Trigger an event every X seconds.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Convenience conditions, actions and behaviors for timers to trigger a condition every X seconds.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: TiledUnitsBar
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A bar that represents a resource in the game (health, mana, ammo, etc).
description: A bar that represents a resource in the game (health, mana, ammo, etc).
There are ready-to-use resource bars in the asset-store [resource bars pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=resource-bars-resource-bars).

changelog.breaking: - Resource bars now use "variants", allowing easy swapping of their visual aspect. You will have to make some adjustments to existing resource bars in your project. Follow this [migration documentation](https://wiki.gdevelop.io/gdevelop5/objects/custom-objects-prefab-template/migrate-to-variants/) to do these changes.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: LinearMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects on a straight line.
description: Move objects on a straight line or according to their angle.

It can be used for simple enemies or bullets. It's usually not adapted for players (other behaviors are a better choice) or bullets fired with the actions provided by the "Fire Bullet" behavior (these bullets are already moved using a force).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move objects on a straight line.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: LinearMovement

eventsFunctions.description: the speed on X axis of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: SpeedX

eventsFunctions.description: the speed on Y axis of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: SpeedY

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move objects ahead according to their angle.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: LinearMovementByAngle

eventsFunctions.description: the speed of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: Speed

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Gruk
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: TimedBackAndForthMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This behavior moves objects back and forth for a chosen time or distance, vertically or horizontally.
description: This behavior moves an object (like an enemy) for a chosen time or distance, then flips it and starts over, moving the object back and forth, vertically or horizontally.
Note: animations must be facing **Right** (for horizontal) or **Down** (for vertical) direction.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Move an object (e.g. enemy) for a chosen time or distance, then flip it and start over. 
Note: animations should be facing LEFT.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: TimedBackAndForthMirroredMovement

events.comment: vertical mode
initialize
distance has been reached, flip it
max time has been reached, flip it
horizontal mode
initialize
distance has been reached, flip it
max time has been reached, flip it
store current elapsed time (to make sure time has passed)

propertyDescriptors.label: Move the object vertically (instead of horizontally)
propertyDescriptors.name: Vertical

propertyDescriptors.label: position of the sprite at the previous frame
propertyDescriptors.name: LastPosition

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AnimatedBackAndForthMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make the object go on the left, then when some distance is reached, flip and go back to the right. Make sure that your object has two animations called "GoLeft" and "TurnLeft".
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Make the object go on the left, then when some distance is reached, flip and go back to the right. **Make sure** that your object has **two animations called "GoLeft" and "TurnLeft"**.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Make the object go on the left, then when some distance is reached, flip and go back to the right. Make sure that your object has two animations called "GoLeft" and "TurnLeft".
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: AnimatedBackAndForthMirroredMovement

events.comment: Move the object to the left or right
If the distance "DistanceX" is reached, turn the object
At the end of the turn, go back to moving to th left (or right if flipped)

propertyDescriptors.label: Speed on X axis, in pixels per second
propertyDescriptors.name: SpeedX

propertyDescriptors.label: Distance traveled on X axis, in pixels
propertyDescriptors.name: DistanceX

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

changelog.breaking: - Buttons now use "variants", allowing easy swapping of their visual aspect. You will have to make some adjustments to existing buttons in your project. Follow this [migration documentation](https://wiki.gdevelop.io/gdevelop5/objects/custom-objects-prefab-template/migrate-to-variants/) to do these changes.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: EllipseMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects on ellipses or smoothly back and forth in one direction.
description: It allows objects to move:
- on an ellipsis or arcs
- smoothly vertically or horizontally (by setting one radius to 0)
- on a sine wave (by adding a force)
Instances will start their movement from their initial position on the scene.
The center position will be decided according to the "initial direction" angle and the radius.
It can be used for:
- Making objects float, such as powerups or coins
- Moving platforms
- Enemy movement patterns
- Making a player constantly turn right or left ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://star-seeker))

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move objects on ellipses or smoothly back and forth in one direction.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: EllipseMovement

events.comment: Evaluate the center of movement from the object position and properties.
Update the center when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Place the object according to the movement angle.
Save the position to detect when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Update the movement angle for the next frame.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Entropy, VegeTato
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Flash
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make an object flash visibility (blink), color tint, object effect, or opacity (fade).
description: Make an object flash for a period of time so that it alternates between two different states.
Includes the ability to flash visibility (blink), color tint, object effect, or opacity (fade).
After adding a behavior to an object, you **trigger the effect** by using the **Flash action**.
This can be used to:
- Let players know they are invincible after being hit
- Catch player attention on the interface (for instance a "press start" text)
